Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, well located, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: sonia530
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days at this hotel during my honeymoon. My husband and I loved it. It's located in the swanky Gracia district, and the hotel holds up to the area. Very classy from top to bottom, from decor to service. It's located a short walk from bus stops and the train lines, making it really convenient to get around town. There's a direct line from there to La Rambla, one of the tourist hotspots in Barcelona. There is also a lot to see in the area around the hotel. The kitchen does not have a microwave, but otherwise has everything else you'll need: 2 burner stove, fridge, sink, a pot, a pan, utensils, plates, cups. After we used dishes, the cleaning staff left us a bottle of dishwashing soap but no sponge. I bought one from the Consum supermarket just a few doors down. We saved a lot of money by picking up breakfast and snack items at Consum and storing them at the hotel. There is free wifi, which I was able to get quite easily from my phone but my husband could not. They also have two computers in the lobby which are free to use. The service was absolutely fantastic. Many staff members spoke English and were able to make recommendations on where to go, how to get there, and how to stay safe (e.g., definitely see La Rambla, but beware pickpockets at night). They ordered us a taxi for our early morning flight out so we didn't have to worry about it. My only complaint is the noise. The walls are very thin, and we could hear everything from neighboring rooms. The first morning, I woke up to a neighbor's cell phone alarm, which coincidentally was the same tone as mine. It made me wake up thinking my phone was going off in my purse, when it was actually from another phone and room entirely. I would absolutely stay here again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Family break to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Caroline1116
Reviews.Content: I visited Barcelona for the first time in February this year (2012). We travelled with 2 kids age 13 & 9. The hotel staff were super and very helpful. Breakfast was the best I have had abroad. We did have to get a train to the main strip 'the rambles' but tickets were very cheap and again staff at the stations always willing to help. The hotel room was very family friendly and had kitchenette and fridge along with a double and 2 single beds. Did not try the restaurent but seemed popular. No bar but could order drinks from reception. Would definitely stay again if we were back in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “recent trip”
Reviews.Author: vellavida
Reviews.Content: we just came back from Barcelona,stayed in this hotel and we considered ourselves lucky in choosing this aparthotel,location is perfect ,it is 5 minute walk to Gracia subway station,when you leave the hotel you turn left and walk down the road Gracia station is before the construction site,when you cross the road from the station 2 blocks away is the Gran de Gracia turn right it will become Passeig de Gracia,the shopping district ( high end prices .the aparthotel is very accessible to everything bus,subway trains,oriental grocery store/spanish regular stores is just outside of the aparthotel,it is also walkng distance to where you pick up the Barcelona Bus Turistic.the neigborhood around this Aparthotel is also a plus,quiet and decent professional people.We stayed away from eating in the restaurants near the tourist sites and the price really drop big time,we ate with the locals. Should we go back again we will choose this aparthotel again,the staff are helpful and always available when you need them ,they try to make your stay in Barcelona as comfortable as possible.No regrets with this Aparthotel.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable”
Reviews.Author: CrisaG
Reviews.Content: Nice , downtown 10 min from the hotel ,clean and affordable

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough for the price”
Reviews.Author: Stanleythemanly
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here during December 2011. The hotel is less than 10min walk from Gracia station. Make sure that you do not get off at Passag d'Gracia, as you will have a long walk ahead of you (as we did!) We arrived early in the morning and were unable to check in until 2pm. We were able to leave our luggage at the hotel and see Barcelona. The hotel clearly has a large focus on image. All staff were faultless in their appearance, and the ground floor is clean and has a mahogony wood theme (not real, of course). The rooms are very large and spacious, as are the beds. However, it is a case of two single beds pushed together - which will be very uncomfortable if you happen to fall between them during the night. The bathroom is also very spacious, but the quality of the shower left a lot to be desired. Water pressure was poor, and the temperature changed from freezing to boiling within seconds. The main drawback about this place - do not stay here if you want a good night's sleep! There is a bar right outside, and rauchous noise continued until about 4.30am each night. The sound was so loud, and carried into the room so easily, that they may as well have been partying in our room! We only got 3-4 hours each night. We did however manage to get this place at a bargain basement price, and were travelling on a strict budget. Aside from the gorgeous staff members, this hotel has few redeeming features. If I had my time again I would definitely looking elsewhere, even though we got the room for €60 per night.

Reviews.Title: “very decent place with only one issue”
Reviews.Author: papeetee
Reviews.Content: It’s a rather nice hotel with great very spacious rooms, a big bathroom, a small kitchen with some appliances. Very good price/quality ratio! The room you get for once actually looks like the one on the pictures at the hotel’s website. There is a good breakfast buffet with lots of choice and very friendly staff. The location is ok, it’s a little bit far from placa Cataluna, espana etc but there is good metro connection so that’s ok. The only major issue is how thin the walls and the windows are. You can hear literally everything which is going on in the room next and above of yours as well as the noise from the street, which luckily isn’t one of the major but there is still some noise. I know it’s difficult but if this problem was solved it would be a perfect hotel for a stay in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL AND STAFF”
Reviews.Author: Wlimardad
Reviews.Content: We 60 yrs+ couple from Canada stayed here for 5 days. Excellent overall experience. Very large, clean and comfortable rooms; equipped with fridge and cooking facilities and utensils. Rooms are quiet and house keeping services are very good. Staff was very professional, helpful and courteous. MONIKA AND PEBLO at the front desk were specially helpful; they went out of their way to help and advise re. "where is what" and "what to do and Don't" in the city and around and made our stay "special"...Thanks to them. The hotel restaurant served delicious breakfast at very reasonable price. Though the location is about 2.5 km north of the city center, the hotel provides excellent value for your $. Santosh & Malti G.

Reviews.Title: “excellant value, spacious and clean”
Reviews.Author: ady348
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel, the location is okay , there are lots of dinning options near this hotel. The room space is terrafic with a kitchen. Staff very courteous and always ready to help.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place,nice people”
Reviews.Author: oudi
Reviews.Content: We are a family with children .The hotel is very good ,rooms very big and clean with a small kitchen,The reception were helpful,friendly and nice.I will sure come again to this hotel. The location of the hotel is very good but you need a map first.It is close to the train.The worst thing in this hotel is the breakfast it is sooooo poor ,you had better buy bread and cheese and at your room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Fiona J
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my husband, daughter and mother. The staff were very friendly and helpful, rooms were clean and well-appointed and the restaurant within the hotel was excellent. It is within 10 minutes stroll of the metro system (which is fantastic, we used it every day, very convenient) and 5 mins from the bus stop (which I must confess we did not use) and if we are fortunate enough to make it back to Barcelona this hotel would be my first choice! The hotel recommended a restaurant the first night called Mussol, which serves delicious Catalunyan fare - this is where we received our free drinks. We did take earplugs with us, quite pleased we did so as it was still very warm and the air-conditioning unit was a little noisy (as was the piping, possibly due to the age of the building) but the beds were very comfortable and the mixtap shower was great (very good waterpressure) - we got a wee glimpse into one of the rooms which is currently being upgraded and it looked great - I think they are upgrading the rooms one by one so when we return we have an even better room to look forward to! The balcony was spacious in our room and we spent a lot of time there after dinner at night - Mum's room had a much smaller balcony but a larger living area ( I think to do with the direction her room was facing), but both suites had plenty of room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a peaceful area”
Reviews.Author: annie_se
Reviews.Content: Mariano Cubi is located in a peaceful area just 5 minutes from the subway station Gracia. The hotel has a reception and elevators. We had an apartment with bathroom, kitchenette and small balcony. The apartment had aircondition and heat (for winter) and you can adjust the airconditioning yourself. The cleaning staff were a little bite slow sometimes, but they were always polite and frequently replaced the free toiletries with new ones. The apartment was cleaned, but the equipment in the kitchenette was insufficient. (We actually bought a pan and utensils at a shop at the same street as the hotel, because we cooked meals.) There is several supermarkets nearby the hotel if you want to buy food for cooking. Consum - the closest supermarket is just a minute away from Mariano Cubi.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Sheefo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and it was great.. staff was very pleasent and helpful..room very spacious and clean and had a small kitchen and a clean and modern bathroom was .. location was very convenient with a nearby metro station "Gracia" making Plaza Catalunya and Passeig de Gracia merely minutes away. Neighbourhood was quiet and safe at night which was important for us as we were three young women travelling alone. We also liked the fact that a supermarket and hairdresser were just a few footsteps away.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mariarivange
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spend two wonderful weeks in Barcelona, and this hotel was perfect for us. Not located in a "touristy" place, but very well connected by Metro,train and bus, just a few minutes walk to the different stops. Also walking distance to Passeig De Gracia and Rambla Catalunya. This hotel is in a Barcelona neighborhood, were you can mix with the locals, so you get a flavor of how they really live. Full of little cafes, bars and restaurants as well as a convenient supermarket one block away. The staff was very helpful and friendly, any question I had if they didn't know, they would search it for me. The room was very clean an spacious and the bed was very comfortable. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “very happy with location and with service”
Reviews.Author: FabdabIreland Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, clean and nicely presented. The staff were friendly, we received champagne and olives on arrival. staff very helpful with tourist information. Little supermarket just up the street, very handy for stocking the fridge with snacks etc. The room overall was large but the bed area was small, we had a very large balcony our room was a corner room so I guess that is why

Reviews.Title: “Poor quality hotel, would not return”
Reviews.Author: ceceontheroad
Reviews.Content: I do not know how this hotel is listed as a 4 star hotel. I stayed for a week with my husband. The first two nights we were in a room (first floor) directly above the breakfast area. Starting at 6am there were loud shouts and banging around. After the first night we asked to be moved and we were moved after another night of no sleep. The second room was a little better, but the walls and floors are paper thin. The floors are wood, so you can hear every little step anyone takes above you. Barcelona is a late night city, so guests are returning at all hours of the night. Of course there was some noise from outside the hotel, but the biggest problem was from within. We ended up having to run our cell phone background noise apps the entire night, every night. We also requested a wake up call most mornings, just in case our phone alarms didn't work. It ended up being a running joke between us on whether or not we were going to get one. I think we got one about half the time the requested. So do not depend on it as your only source (which you might have to since there is no clock in the room). Lastly, I had some laundry go missing from my room. I never asked for it to be cleaned. The front desk said the maid had sent it to the laundry. I was annoyed, but even more so when I had to leave 2 days later and there was still no sign of my clothing. They took my address and promised to send it on when it arrived. The very next day I received an email explaining the laundry never had my clothing and the maid claims to have never removed anything from my room. I felt a bit as if they had just waited for me to leave to tell me the whole story. I can't imagine anyone actually stealing my dirty clothes, but they were misplaced. Now the hotel is offering free parking or a room upgrade upon my return. I have no plans to visit Barcelona again, and certainly wouldn't choose to stay here if I were, mainly due to the noise issue. Other than the way the management/staff is handling my lost clothing issue, which I of course find poor, I did find the front desk staff pleasant. The rooms are clean, and the location is fine. But, this is not a 4 star hotel. And, if you aren't an incredibly sound sleeper, avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel but poor staff...”
Reviews.Author: Skaffm
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well situated, 5 min from the Gracia metro station which takes you everywhere! you are 2 stops away from las ramblas and placa cataluna . The rooms are very spacious we were 3 in one room and had tons of space without stepping on each others toes.The beds are very comfortable especially after a night of hardcore partying.The bathroom is rather okay ! spacious bathtub and the showering amenities smell really nice . However,the staff was not very friendly, Upon arrival the only thing we got from the receptionist was : Check in time is at 2 pm and when asked for a recommendation for a restaurant we only got the name of an area..... mmm The next day we asked for an iron board ..the receptionist told us to call housekeeping without putting us through ... We were not made aware of the offers in the hotel especially that we saw in the elevator that for 20 euros more we could have got an upgrade ! All in all, I would recommend the hotel for people who don't spend time in it. The rooms are more than okay after a loong night ! but beware of the housekeeping that makes tons of noise in the early morning !

Reviews.Title: “A spacious, clean hotel with excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: Beavie_1
Reviews.Content: This Barcelona aparthotal is out of the touristy area... but only 30 minutes away from the city centre. The rooms are very large, clean and well equipped. The staff go out of their way to help all guests. There is a great choice for breakfast and if it is included in the price it is excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were large and spacious, no free glass of wine on arrival, extra charge for bathrobes”
Reviews.Author: Anjali27
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly, rooms were large and spacious - we had a quad & triple room. We didn't eat in the restaurant as it was so expensive. Advertised as free glass of wine on arrival, bathrobes and slippers available - no glass of wine was provided and there was an extra charge for the robes & slippers. Location was good not far from a metro station. It was about a 25 min walk from the hotel to the main station, although we did get a little lost on the day we arrived and no-one seemed to be able to direct us! Overalll we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I will recomend it to all the people I know”
Reviews.Author: Bianca2258
Reviews.Content: I'll begin by saying that what you see is what you get. This was the best hotel I have stayed in ever. Very spacious rooms, clean and modernly furnished. The kitchenette was great to have, because Barcelona is not that cheap. The hotel staff was extremely helpful with what ever we needed. They even have tickets for the main sites at the hotel so you don't have to wait in line to buy a ticket (and believe there are at least 10-15 min lines). Hotel Mariano Cubi has a very good location on a quite street close to the city center. If you wish to go to Barcelona for the beach (which I don't advice) you might want to book some hotel near to the seaside. we went only in 2 occasions to the beach but it was a nice walk from the subway along the port. Before leaving I've read reviews that the breakfast wasn't so god and diverse, but here I ate some delicious sausages every morning. Only to have spare room to eat all there was on the table. Indeed the menu wasn't changed daily, but how much can you eat one time? You can try every day something new from the dishes offered. I think I didn't like Barcelona as much as I liked the hotel. I loved all: services, cleanliness, location, rooms; there's just nothing bad that I could say. Oh! Nonetheless it's a GREAT VALUE FOR MONEY. Actually I could even say it's cheap. Hope you enjoy your stay at Mariano Cubi.

Reviews.Title: “TOTALLY RECOMMENDED / GENIAL”
Reviews.Author: RedThunderbird
Reviews.Content: Perfect for a quiet, chilled stay. We stayed in room 406, with double bed, bathroom with shower and bathtub, bidet and toiletries; kitchenette and fridge; sink, crockery and cutlery, a couple of basic pots, tv with EXCELLENT movie selection (mostly in Spanish of course); small balcony, desk...space....the only noise is the recycling rubbish collection around 11 pm every night, but that is the same all around town, so you just need to put up with 5 minutes of lorry noise :D My partner and I bought a few basics in the mini-supermarket (50 mts from hotel!) so we could have late breakfasts in bed, snacks or just a simple dinner inn...that was economical and also great as backup plan B. The staff (Marilyn, Eduardo and the rest) were great, always helpful..., the cleaning ladies very friendly and we just had the best time. There is a safe in the room but also a safe at reception. Free use of 2 PC's on the lobby with wi fi. A taxi ride from Estacio del Nord is about 12 euros. A bus/metro ticket for ten trips (you can use it within 2 months!) was about 8 euros (=great!). We walked almost everywhere....the Passeig de Gracia and all its cool hip shops is about ten minutes away through leafy, lovely roads full of boutiques, hairdressers and shops. The area is somewhat residential....bus 17 a block away takes you to Laietana Street, where you can walk to the main Gothic quarter and Ramblas in 5 minutes. Bus 92 three blocks away or so, takes you to Gaudi's Parc Guell. Overall, EXCELENTE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Barcelona visit”
Reviews.Author: joceh
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6 day stay in Barcelona - and I have to say that staying in the Gracia area, in the Mariano Cubi turned out to be the smart decision. A 6 minute walk to the Fontana Metro, or a 5 minute walk to the Diagonal and Via Augusta, this location provided a respite from the bustling touristy areas like La Rambla. My family and I had no difficulty finding great tapas, and there was a convenient grocery store two doors down. Because we stayed in a 'family' room at the hotel, we had a stove and a sink and fridge so we were able to bring some food in (which helps with teenagers.) The hotel staff were friendly and fairly knowledgeable about getting around (the only question they didn't know was something about customs.) This hotel says that it caters to business people, but we saw many families. Free WiFi in the rooms was a huge plus. Clean, quiet, pleasant, and great location. I would go back in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “Home Run”
Reviews.Author: jorgemb
Reviews.Content: Large rooms. Very clean, well located and extremely friendly and effective staff. Would recommend it without reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel did not live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: bdl729
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 11 AM on May 14th 2010. We were told by two ladies at the front desk that our room would be ready by 1 pm. We were told to get a coffee and come back. Well the place that was recommended was full so we sat in the lobby and waited. And waited, and waited some more. I saw several guests coming in and going right up to their rooms. I asked the guy that was at the front desk now and he said they wouldn't be ready for another hour. I was upset that we were told 1 pm and now it is 1:30 and they are still not ready. He was very rude and said the girl was new and didn't know anything. I told him two people told us 1 pm. Finally he says the room is ready but the beds are not done. When we got to the room they seemed done to me. We even asked housekeeping and she said she had finished. Every night we heard the staff talking as the office/housekeeping area was near our room. We also heard people banging on the trash bins outside and men singing at 3 AM. We never had a good night's sleep the two nights we were there. We complained to the front desk and they all acted like we were crazy and they never heard any complaints about this before. The breakfast was alright but not worth the 12 euros!This was a horrible hotel and I will never stay there again when we return to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: GrapevineMom
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 6-day stay at one of their family/quad rooms. There were 4 single beds - 2 of them pushed together to form a double. The kitchenette was very helpful since we decided to forego with the hotel breakfast. At 12 euros each a day for 4 people, it would have cost way too much. We bought freshly baked baguettes & pastries from a nearby bakery and other breakfast items from the supermart next door. We even managed to prepare scrambled eggs. The coffee and tea on the countertop was free but the rest of the snacks and the drinks in the fridge were mini-bar items that the hotel was selling. There was a plug/outlet in the bathroom which was also a voltage transformer/adapter. Wi-fi was free but you need to ask the receptionist for the password - you also had to ask them for a key to the safe, if you want to use it. We used the Metro to go around - Gracia is on the same street and was nearer (maybe 5-7 minutes walk). Fontana (L3) is about 2x as far but took you to more places directly. When taking the green line (L3), do not let anybody get near you. My husband was nearly pickpocketed twice. Once at the Fontana escalator on our way out (4 men pretended to hurry past up - but he heard the velcro on his short pocket opening) and the other, on our way into a train in the Espanya station - around 4 people jostled him going in and then they got off before the train doors slid shut. Both times they did not get anything because he was wearing a money belt (less than $7 from Target). Last tip, most of the restaurants and shops are closed on Sundays (including the nearby supermart) :(

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, spacious and clean”
Reviews.Author: Joanne1985
Reviews.Content: I've never stayed ina hotel with sooooo much storage space and shelving in one room, which was a real plus as some one who traveks with lots of accessories, shoes and make up! The apartment was really large and kept cool even on the hottest of days due to excellent air conditioning. It was ever so slightly noisy outside where the air vent was but nothing you could not get used to after a couple of hours and as far as I could tell there was no bar/nightclub on the road so don't know what the comments about noise from that are all about! The little kitchen with fridge, sink, two hobs and a couple of pans is perfect for cooking up some pasta if you run out of pennies on your last night but don't go expecting to be able to rustle up a full Sunday lunch (Although with a tapas bar just up the road wtih wine at 1.40 a glass and tapas around the same price you should be fine!) Really easy to get to pretty much everywhere else in the city from Gracia tube stop and also the lady at reception pointed out another stop called Fontana about 5mins away that connected to even more stuff with less changing lines! All in all a fab hotel, great value for money and very safe and clean. Only complaint for me is that there was no full lenght mirror in the room...bathroom one was pretty big but could have done with another!

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother with this one - too noisy and expensive for the money.”
Reviews.Author: travel123edmonton
Reviews.Content: This place is spacious, clean, and has a funny little kitchenette. There is also a bar across the street that blasts noise from evening until the wee hours. We were on the forth floor, and I'm telling you - NO SLEEP for days!! There was also a water line break in the middle of the night, and the upstairs tennants needed to be noisily moved. Our bathroom also had a leak. The funny thing was, I read a similar review to this and assumed that all the plumbing problems would be fixed by the time we tried it. Also, we were charged 12 Euro per person for a so-so breakfast buffet. Definately NOT worth the money. Our wake-up call was not acted upon, fortunately, I heard them ring the wrong room through the paper thin walls and woke up in time. Skip this joint! Don`t do it!

Reviews.Title: “okay, but far better in the area for less money”
Reviews.Author: hitchdovar
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two months with my grandmother. My Uncle booked it for us on the recommendation of his travel agent. The location is fine - love Gracia - the hotel is perfectly fine. I will say though having been subsequently to BCN many times - if you use the ktichenette in this amazing eating city, you are doing something wrong. Overall, I loved my time here - but not really because of the hotel - it was just kind of there... Also, on my first night I asked where the gay bars were - and the desk clerk freaked out and said he didn't know then called a cab - I think any good hotel staff in a major metropolitan area should be able to point out at least one gay bar...

Reviews.Title: “Very up to date hotel”
Reviews.Author: SpainMart2009
Reviews.Content: We really did not expect what we encountered. Very clean, looked like a new hotel with very modern furnishings. Very comfortable. Staff very helpful. Would definitely recommend it. Parking very tight but available none the less.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: viajandito
Reviews.Content: When i first arrived to barcelona I stayed here for a few days until i found where to live. They made me feel at home right away. The service was absolutely wonderful, great location, and great pice!

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: toni175
Reviews.Content: this is a great hotel at a great location--up the street from gracia station--you can get to la rambla in literally 5min on metro from here--the hotel staff were extremely friendly and extremely helpful on suggestions of where to eat, see a show or tour bus--they all seemed to speak at least 5 languages fluently--the rooms are modern, clean, large and the showers/bathrooms are great-they also have wifi and room svc-I also recommend taking the breakfast option--the food was plentiful and they had many selections--there is no downside to this place and the price was @ $110 per night--we stayed the last weekend in december--it's simple--when in barcelona you stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Debbie6327
Reviews.Content: Not sure where the pictures online came from but the room we had was nothing like them . Stated coffee and tea making facilities bath robes slippers free glass of cava on arrival ,we had none of these. Went down to reception and was given a jug 2 sachets of coffee sugar milk and 2 cups. Put jug on hob to boil some water 30 mins later it was barely warm so gave up and went to bed . Woke in the night by window coming open couldn't get it to close properly and it rattled the rest of the night . Lots of noise out side and on night two other hotel guest very loud until early hours Had booked a twin room . Got a room with a double bed in bedroom and a single in the lounge /kitchen area . Bottom of shower curtain was black ,plug in sink didn't stop the water runnng straight out . Thankfully we where only there for 2 nights .

Reviews.Title: “Not a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Gur1234
Reviews.Content: I booked two nights at the Mariana Cubi. The booking website I used showed that the hotel was classed as a four start hotel and the picture of a typical room looked smart and well furnished. I arrived late (booking was guaranteed) and was placed in a room that looked like student accommodation from the 1960's. My complaints were met with excuses that the manager was not in till mid-day the following morning. The following day I spoke to the manager who did change my room to one which matched the descriptions on the website. However no recompense for the previous nights stay was entertained. I've stayed in a number of hotels in Barcelona and this is by far the worst. My advice is book somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “The staff of this Hotel saved my Barcelona visit!!”
Reviews.Author: jintsjason
Reviews.Content: So I arrived on barcelona late on a Friday night only to find that my original choice had given away my reservation due to a booking.com error (Hostal HMB). There were no other rooms available until Sunday and Toni at Hostal HMB set me up at a small hotel (Hostal Amsterdam) that should be stayed away from at all costs. The people at Mariano Cubi (down the street) not only let me use their WIFI to find a room (I ended up staying at the Mariano Cubi for two nights), but let me keep my valuables there as the Hostal Amsterdam was basically a transient hotel. In other words, they saved my trip! Now, as to staying there. The rooms are fantastic, clean and possess great bathrooms and free WiFi. The bed was not that comfortable, but a small complaint! If you can get a booking there through booking.com, I highly recommend it as I think the rack rate is a bit too high. Again, the staff is EXCEPTIONAL!! It's a bit of a hike from the nearest Metro stop (Fontana), but Barcelona is a wonderful city to walk in, so big deal. Again, stay here if you get a price break!

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: sepos
Reviews.Content: Long story but we actually transferred from the Arts Hotel to Cubi and we were very happy. The hotel is a perfect 4*. Clean, quiet, and reasonable. Free internet. Supermarket next door.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room”
Reviews.Author: navvy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a triple room. It was huge, with a kitchenette. The room was very clean, and overall very nice. However, the kitchenette did not have any provision to make tea/coffee and there were no utencils for reheating food etc. It would be better to have a microwave oven in this for use, as the kitchenette was of no use to us at all. The location was good, and for guests internet was free in the lobby. This was great!

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: Citybreaker9
Reviews.Content: We booked up months in advance, but we were allocated an old non-refurbished room, which was not even 2* standard. On the first morning all our cash went missing from our room when we were having breakfast ! We asked to change rooms and the next one was much better - what you would be expect in a 4* hotel. The hotel has redeeming features, good location, reasonable food, some friendly staff (some not so friendly). Overall a mixed experience, which we would not care to repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep optional”
Reviews.Author: Walklates world wide whims
Reviews.Content: When it really comes down to it, this is a budget hotel. On a value for money judgement its probably quite good and it certainly appeals to a lot of young people visiting on a budget. Its attractive, well designed, rooms are of good size and it has good clean bathrooms. It doesnt have a view but looks out over local streets. Breakfast is basic but ok. The problem is that it just isnt well soundproofed. Of our three nights the first two were spent listening to the detailed german conversations below us. The last night was better but the soundproofing is so bad that I could actually hear the man shaving in the room next door. Not that unusual you may say. No, apart from the fact he was using a wet razor. If you want to enjoy barcelona's night life then come home at five and sleep during the day then this might be ok. If your body clock works to normal night and day, then perhaps you need to think again. A final word. If you do go, then check out the little restaurant just a bit to the right from the front entrance. Brilliant food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: laurad656
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel for a great price from Trip Advisor. Arrived at 11am and were able to check in then even though it is usually 2pm. Having researched the hotel before we went we knew this was a modern hotel. When we got to our room though we were really disappointed. Apparently only certain rooms in the hotel have been refurbished (it was built in the 1970's) and obviously we had been given one of the old rooms, which although was in good condition was not the beautiful modern room we had seen on the hotel's website and were expecting. After speaking to reception, they admitted some rooms were old although this was not advertised on their website and was in some ways false advertising. I was told there was nothing that could be done for the first nights stay but they would try and find a alternative room for the following two nights. II found this strange considering I watched 3 people check out and it was still only 11am but........... Anyway the following day we had out new room which was far superior. WORD OF WARNING - if you stay at this hotel make sure it is not a room on the 5th floor as they are all old rooms. We were moved to the 3rd and they were lovely. The hotel breakfast was fantastic with cereal, fruit, ham and cheese etc croissants/pain au choc and cooked breakfast. Was lovely and clean and the food was of a high standard. We couldn't complain. The location of the hotel I thought was excellent. It was about a 35 minute walk to Las Ramblas although you could get the metro from Gracia station about a 4 minute walk from the hotel. Make sure you get a T-10 ticket - 10 journeys for 6 euros odd and it can be used by more than one person. Taxi at night to/from Placa de Catalunya was between 5-7 euros. Although the hotel was on a small side road the area felt quite safe as it was towards the business district. Had we been given a modern room from our first nights stay I couldn't have been more pleased although it would not stop me from staying here again as it was very well maintained and was great value for the standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but......”
Reviews.Author: Polodriver
Reviews.Content: Very clean, modern, quiet street, 5 minutes to the FGC, very friendly and helpful staff, large room, overall excellent value - but - the sound proofing is apparantly non existent and unfortunately we had a group of young men below us who seemed to have gone to Barcelona to sleep during the day and party at night! Reception dealt with my complaint straight away after being woken up at 6.00am by what seemed to be party of 50 people below us, and the music was turned off but I wish I had insisted on changing rooms because the following night was again noisy with shouts, banging doors, etc. In the end I turned on the kitchen extractor fan to drown out the noise which helped! A real shame and very unfortunate as the hotel is basically an excellent find and I'm sure if we had had any much quieter guests below us, this would have been a 110% positive review. Maybe I am too sensitve?..........

Reviews.Title: “What more could you want?”
Reviews.Author: donaldgregoryBelfast
Reviews.Content: Very good sized modern clean quiet room for 3 adults Location 2 minutes from Gracia metro Staff very welcoming There is a fabulous restaurant just opposite on the right side leaving the hotel on the corner Location is perfect for shopping and local bars The buffet breakfast gets a bit tired come 10.30am so eat early. If you are a real coffee fan sadly you will not be enthused by their offering but its a small sacrifice for such a super hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend for 2 nights (3rd and 4th of May) while on our backpacking trip in europe. It is a pleasant hotel. The Garcia metro station is about 200 m away from the hotel. Taxi from the airport to the hotel cost about 20euros. The hotel provides free internet access. Remember to bring your laptop or palm PC along. If not, there are 2 computers in the lobby for your usage. The room is large and well decorated. The hotel staffs are friendly and knowledgable, do ask them where to get the best paella and sangria. The breakfast is abit boring but it comes with our package, so its alright. To get around barcelona, get a 10 trips ticket from the metro. It allows u to use it 10 times. The metro is good enough to get around to most tourist areas in barcelona. I will definitely stay here when I visit barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: Zappafrank
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for long weekend and found facilities very good. Was able to check in early and you get a glass of cava when checking in. Room spotless and very large. Has a kitchen but no utensils unless you ask for them. But then who goes self catering in Barcelona. Breakfast was great value and good quality and service.Its in a quiet area but only 2 stops on the FGC underground to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in one of the Mariano Cubi's spacious triple rooms. This room was large by any standard. It featured three twin beds with good linens, a kitchen bar (sink, refrigerator, and two burner electric range) with two stools, a desk and chair, two club chairs, a nightstand, a coffee table, t.v., full-length mirror, safe, three telephones, good lighting and controls, and a closet. The floors were wood laminate and more wood was used to accent the room. The spacious, marble tiled bathroom featured a tub with a shower that had good water pressure, bidet, toilet, and large mirror over a counter with double sink. Our room and all of the public spaces in the hotel were meticulously maintained and spotlessly clean. The hotel has two small lifts which are adequate for its five floors and 67 rooms. We found the two computers in the lobby with free Internet service to be convenient and usually available. Internet connections are in the rooms for guests who bring their own computers. The breakfast was included in our room rate and proved to be an excellent value. It featured three types of eggs (scrambled, fried, and soft boiled), several types of cereal, a wide variety of bread, bacon, sausages, cold meats, cheeses, several varieties of fruits and pastries, juices, coffee, and tea. It is a buffet but friendly staff are on hand to serve coffee and tea and constantly replenish the food. Late in the day, coffee and tea are available in the dining room along with a few tapas. Dinner is also served at the hotel. In the evening, the front desk welcomes guests with a glass of Cava which you can take to your room. There are cafes, spas, beauty shop,clothing and shoe stores, a bakery, small supermarket, and several green grocers close by the hotel. The Gracia metro stop is also nearby. We can't say enough about the hotel staff. They all made an extra effort to make our stay enjoyable. They provided directions, made recommendations for dining, etc. and even made reservations for us. It is true as other reviewer's have commented that there are no utensils, etc. in the rooms but we found that everything was promptly supplied as soon as we made a request to the staff. We have already recommended this hotel to friends who enjoy Barcelona.

HotelInfo.Name: Aparthotel Mariano Cubi
HotelInfo.Address: Maria Cubi, 62-64, 08006 Barcelona, Spain
